website_summaries.verdict: A heavy-duty table saw with some unique and helpful features.
pros: Excellent gripping ability and cutting depth
cons: Occasional customer complaints about component failure

customer_reviews.title: Replacement product problems
customer_reviews.text: The first saw was banged up when we opened it so it was returned and promptly replaced with a new one. It finally got warm enough to work in the barn so the replacement was set up. Found peeling, flaking paint on the support frame. A spot that had been touched up with a different color, and the much desired laser guide doesn't work. One of the blade wrenches was also missing. Haven't tried to cut anything yet as it's just too cold in the barn. NOT happy.
customer_reviews.author: Colinda N Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Best table saw period
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a cabinetmaker since I was 16. Rockwell was the brand to buy. I see nothing in this saw that does not make that still true today, despite the vicious reviews. Almost didn’t buy it because of the onslaught of bad reviews, seems almost choreographed. Dewalt makes a nice screw gun, but if you want a serious table saw buy Rockwell. They were making table saws before ANYONE. Handles like a shop saw, not a portable. Solid, fence is good, just push away from you when you slide, it will keep it at 90.
customer_reviews.author: Sailawayny

customer_reviews.title: P.O.S. Rockwell table saw VERY DISAPPOINTING
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this table saw two months ago thinking because it's a Rockwell it'll be precise and operate perfectly. Much to my disappointment the saw does not cut straight. I have tried quality saw blads. The rip fence dosen't clamp on straight. The miter guide has a lot of play. The saw dust discharge dosen't work well there isn't enough pitch for the saw dust to slide into the saw dust bage. I would love to return it but I'm past my 30 days. DON'T WAST YOUR MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.author: TONY

customer_reviews.title: Best in its class.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who needed it for working on her 1st home. She said it was great for her and her husband. This was the best I could find without crossing the thousand mark.people complain about the fence measuring short or long. Even on my shop saw there is variance. So I always measure out and chalk anyway. I felt it was a safe saw for her home projects like wood flooring or frame work.
customer_reviews.author: JUST ANOTHER CAR GUY

customer_reviews.title: good general tool
customer_reviews.text: Liked the portability, the saw throws a lot of chips back at the user when in operator, the laser is pretty much useless being under the piece being cut and it died after two uses, changed batteries and still did not work. The gates and fence are sloppy, good for rough cuts but not good for precise cuts. Overall good saw for home use, would not recommend for finish work.
customer_reviews.author: ptwiraga

customer_reviews.title: Integrated wheels and handle/legs are...handy.
customer_reviews.text: It just arrived. It’s bigger than we thought. We’ll update once we use it. The integrated wheels do make it much more compact to move around than others and the handle/legs are very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Clark B. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great GP table saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw has worked for me and I have had no problem with it. I have ripped 2x4s to 1x2s and 1/2x 1s, cut full length plywood, no issues. Currently working on finer cuts but need a finer blade than what came with the saw. Easy to handle with the folding legs and wheels. For building chicken houses, ripping laminate flooring, fences and sheds it has worked great. If you're talented enough to build furniture and cabinets you already know this portable saw will not work for you, to suggest it should is unreasonable.
customer_reviews.author: AZJ

customer_reviews.title: First saw defectve
customer_reviews.text: First saw had defective blade mount. Shaft comes out of motor and it was not straight so you couldn't put a blade on. Between first order, returned defective and getting new saw it took about 3 weeks. Amazon and UPS did not communicate for pickup so we brought it out to UPS ourselves. But new saw is fine, nice big table and folds up easy.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Manley

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this saw.
customer_reviews.text: I don't really write negative reviews, but this is the absolute worst piece of hardware I've ever bought and I've bought lots of hardware. 1st so much plastic. It's the cheapest built hardware I've seen. 2and very wobbly, not sturdy at all. 3rd the blade hits the table. No way to adjust so the blade will bot hit the table. Had to dissemble it and send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! Alignment issues with the blade
customer_reviews.text: As an experience woodworker I was excited to get my hands on this saw. Unfortunately when the saw arrived the blade was out of alignment with the table. It was out of alignment by 1/8” over six inches. The owners manual is of no help. There is nothing to indicate that there is a way to adjust the alignment of this saw. I then searched the internet looking for help on how to fix the alignment. I then learned that this is a common problem with this saw.
customer_reviews.author: AMerrell

customer_reviews.title: Don't waist your money!
customer_reviews.text: The blade was wobbly. Couldn't get an accurate and safe cut. Got in contact with Worx and they sent what they thought would fix the problem. It didn't fix the problem. So as a solution they were going to replace the saw with one that was half the value and quality. In the process of trying to get a refund right now.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for my evolving requirements....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this folding table saw a while ago to replace an old, Ryobi BT3000 precision table saw that I'd bought over 20 years ago. While love the ability to fine tune the BT3000, my need for that precision has faded and I didn't like the space that it took when it wasn't being used. To that end, a portable, folding table saw met my new, evolving requirements perfectly and this fits the bill. I've been happy with it since the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tom L.

customer_reviews.title: This saw sucks!!!
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE saw. Very inaccurate cuts, slight wobble to the blade, but gets stuck frequently making it nearly impossible to switch blades. Inside of saw fills up with sawdust quickly, nearly none gets into the collection bag. Go buy a better saw, it's worth the extra money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rockwell RK7241S MOTOR NOT REPLACEABLE
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Rockwell RK7241S from Amazon in August of 2012. I am a home owner and use the saw very seldom. After about 10 hours of use from 2012 to August 2015 the motor went out. I chatted with Ana at Rockwell about my situation. First she informed me that the warranty was out but she would give me 10% off on a new "tool". I then asked about a replacement motor to which she responded, "I'm sorry, the motor in this tool can not be replaced." YOU DECIDE.
customer_reviews.author: Pigeon Rooster

customer_reviews.title: Great for small shops
customer_reviews.text: This saw is perfect for my small shop (12’ X 24’). It retracts easily and sets up fast. Fences are very accurate and square to the blade. Haven’t figured out what the laser does it seems useless to me. Overall a superb machine.
customer_reviews.author: Stevem3115

customer_reviews.title: Sawless in Seattle
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very satisfied with this product. The only thing that settled well with me was the price. I haven't been able to find any of the accessories they show in the their video, cant even find replacement throat plates. Oh and by the way the blade alignment is horrible with no way to to correct it. I guess I can use it to cut kindling for my firepit this summer ( fingers crossed)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Not promising to start
customer_reviews.text: Well the laser is set to the wrong side of the blade with no way to adjust it. The fence seems not to be square or maybe ad I've read other comments , the motor maybe mounted wrong or out of square. This is just a preliminary look over as the weather isn't cooperating. Also it will not tilt the full 45 degrees. The protective plastic blade cover was chewed up on one side due to it being installed crooked. But if you don't mind those things it has ripped 2"×4" pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Charles poyner

customer_reviews.title: Not as well made as they used to be...
customer_reviews.text: I suppose with today's lowered expectations, this saw should have earned more stars, but the truth is, saws sold to homeowners and DIYer's were much better made even 10 years ago, than they are now. This is the 3rd one I bought before I decided it was good enough to keep (barely). Seems like saws are either cheaply built these days, or made for contractors and professionals and are priced in the thousands. I had to send the first Rockwell back because of slop in the shaftt. This one is better, but not great.
customer_reviews.author: MT Palms

customer_reviews.title: No problems here!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the saw about two years ago. I have ripped over 200 1 X's, miters several and have had no problems. Built the above armoire with it and it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R.

customer_reviews.title: Lack of precision, not worth it
customer_reviews.text: So many great features but the blade wasn’t aligned to the miter and there is no adjustment to make it straight. Returned it looking for something more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: DCH

customer_reviews.title: table not flat
customer_reviews.text: i liked the saw but the top was not close to flat. I returned it
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Getting a great saw!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Had to buy a new blade right away though because the one they sent me was bent from how they packed it which did not make me very happy! Good product for the price though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An affordable, highly useful table saw
customer_reviews.text: After much shopping and putting this thing use, I'm fairly sure you really won't find a better table saw to work with in this price category. Great table. Fair and simple adjustments/settings. I grew-up in construction and I'm using this table saw while remodelling an an abandoned nursing home (a 1950s southwest stucco house). No, it is not some high-end cabinet maker's level of tool, but for a DIY homeowner, you can do some work you'll be proud of.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy it. Just keep scrolling. You don’t get what’s pictured. The saw is severely underpowered. The fence is not accurate at al. The miter gauge wobbles. The table is not well built at all. Save yourself the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great homeowner or contractor saw.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts beautiful, folds nicely, love the attachments. I only wish it didn't blow all the sawdust right up out of the blade area. Even with the bag on or off, it pushes out almost all the dust straight up. I will probably have to hook up my shop vac to eliminate that problem. But very powerful saw.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Great portable table saw...
customer_reviews.text: Great saw at a great price. I especially like the saw dust bag and the ability to wheel it around from place to place.
customer_reviews.author: Exhausted Elmer

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw after resolving quality issues.
customer_reviews.text: The saw as delivered had the blade out of parallel with the rip guides by over .062". This was non adjustable and unacceptable. Within a few days Amazon had delivered a replacement. This one had stripped threads on the fence screws which set the alignment adjustment. A call to Rockwell resulted in a new rip fence assemble. Now that the quality issues are resolved I am pleased with the saw. Amazon and Rockwell's support was commendable.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good and useful.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it a lot since I purchased this equipment. The price is not too bad though. The only issue is the location of the wheels should be by the floor to make it more portable. You would have to fold both legs in order to move and put in storage.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Byer

customer_reviews.title: Great product - Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband as a gift. He loves it and so far it hasn't disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not precise, but decent power and packs up nicely
customer_reviews.text: My main gripe with this saw is that the fence edge is not perfectly flat throughout so it causes your work piece to angle slightly as it moves causing cuts to be NOT straight. For small pieces of wood (2x4, 4x4) this isn't much of a problem as the workpiece remains on the flat section of the fence the entire time, but when cutting longer pieces (plywood or even 1x6 boards) it's a problem. The saw DOES cut through 4x4's, though just barely, and the saw packs up nice and small so it's still an alright saw if you want something that wont take up your whole garage.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rower

customer_reviews.title: Every bit as good as the Craftsman 9-inch saw I bought many years ...
customer_reviews.text: Every bit as good as the Craftsman 9-inch saw I bought many years ago when Craftsman products were somewhat better than today. Assembly was easy and it ran well right out of the box. Fence adjustments are accurate enough for all but the most precise settings. The laser is of negligible value if one measures and marks carefully with a speed square. The dust collection bag is better than a box on the floor under the machine, but not much more. Mounting and removing it to empty is a bit of a chore. A dado insert would have been a desirable extra, but none comes with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Purchased for a relative. No issues or problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. OrrTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cheap parts, DON NOT BUY. Arrived crooked and parts broken
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, blade was crooked and all 4 bolts to align the motor were snapped off. Cheap parts and pieces. Should cost $150 not $500. Do not buy. Wasn’t even able to use. Blade was 1/8” off center and touching the side of the table top.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse B.

customer_reviews.title: perfect cuts super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: perfect cuts super easy to use, only issue I had is storing blade shield little difficult to mount in storage spot because of small locking tab other than that great to use
customer_reviews.author: Gene Schoonover

customer_reviews.title: They need to improve the fence more sawdust balls around ...
customer_reviews.text: They need to improve the fence more sawdust balls around the perimeter of the saw then what goes in the bag to do over again I believe I would get another Dewalt Rockwell needs to look at the fence on the Dewalt
customer_reviews.author: David Marr

customer_reviews.title: Fence design
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good design slight flaws with the fence binds thin sheets of material locking on the fence also has issues of coming loose
customer_reviews.author: Mark O. D. Harlingue

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I never got to use it because the blade arbor was bent out of alignment. When I called Rockwell they said it was a shipping issue because it was not packaged correctly, wait don't they package it? Not a good response. After taking a closer look I was not surprised it was damaged, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Hotdog

customer_reviews.title: I would still recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Everything works perfectly except for the built in ruler for the fence which is off by 1/16th of an inch. I would still recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: A great saw that is portable and actually cuts pretty straight
customer_reviews.text: Whoopie! A great saw that is portable and actually cuts pretty straight. You won't become a Master Cabinet maker with this unit, but it will do anything around you home you need, and do it accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Dannie Hedgpeth

customer_reviews.title: The other great thing I like about it is that it folds ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and so far it is doing everything I need it to do and has made my home remodeling move along a lot faster! I also purchased the finishing unit but I have not used it yet. The other great thing I like about it is that it folds down and is easy to put away.
customer_reviews.author: P. Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Good for lower/mid range saw
customer_reviews.text: Good for lower/mid range saw. Needed a bigger table and I got it with this saw. Good features for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Hannum

customer_reviews.title: The quality is pretty good
customer_reviews.text: The one thing I was disappointed with was the dust bag drawstring bunched up so bad I could not use it again
customer_reviews.author: richard caldwell

customer_reviews.title: great saw but to much plastic
customer_reviews.text: the saw is great with very easy setup and a storage place for everything. BUT the miter is worthless junk and it has to much plastic throughout/ I discarded the sawdust bag and replaced it with a dust chute.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews for this and ultimately pulled the trigger. Really happy with it. I'm a home DIY guy, so I'm not able to offer a pro perspective, but it is a super great saw. Just put together some window sills and couldn't be any happier.
customer_reviews.author: JD Kniepkamp

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Super saw for a super price. A real workhorse that makes very accurate cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Peter P.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy saw. The sawdust collection bag is a bit too easy to tear but otherwise a good saw for the money
customer_reviews.author: Jason E.

customer_reviews.title: lots of power
customer_reviews.text: does everything I could hope for would like to find the ext table for it
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Kamp

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw!
customer_reviews.text: I've no regrets with this saw. Plenty of power, portability, easy set up. I'd put it up against Dewalt any day.
customer_reviews.author: William Peebles

customer_reviews.title: Bad Dado
customer_reviews.text: This saw is ideal for a portable saw. laser is good and dust bag works great. A good alaround saw EXCEPT the shaft that the blade mounts on is so short that you can only use a dado blade up to 5/8 inch. Also Amazon does not offer a Dado insert for this saw. If you find one it costs. Made my own ( Dado & 0 clearance ).
customer_reviews.author: SPA Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific saw, with 30" rip width and full 3-9/16 cut depth. The laser is essentially useless, doesn't show on the wood - should have been left off. My only real complaint is the fact that the listed optional accessories are no longer available (not sure they ever were). I had to fabricate my own dado insert.
customer_reviews.author: Shutter Bug

customer_reviews.title: would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: cheap and flimsy feels more like a toy then a tool should have purchased another rigid a real disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good BUT
customer_reviews.text: I like the saw . It was easy to setup. The only thing I haven't figured out is how the lazer is of any help when the beam doesn't come in on top of the work.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Fold out extension table could be a little stronger, other than that a great saw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: He Love's It
customer_reviews.text: He loves it !!! It is a great Space saver and the cuts are true a master carpenters Dream Would recommend ! He just made a Awesome bed for us Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bianka G.

customer_reviews.title: Rockwell Rocks
customer_reviews.text: My Husband loves his Anniversary gift. I bought him the Jaw Horse last year, so Rockwell is working out well for us.
customer_reviews.author: jkil949

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The tablesaw itself is very good but the rip fence is a joke toy like🙃
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Assembly instructions not the best I've seen and the blade needs replaced
customer_reviews.text: Assembly instructions not the best I've seen and the blade needs replaced,but pleased with the performance of the saw with a good blade put on it.
customer_reviews.author: Meltman

customer_reviews.title: The toll is working H great
customer_reviews.text: So far it is all is was said it was going to be
customer_reviews.author: luis l priego

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great saw, cuts great for any home use, I used it for hard wood and it’s a chap!!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lahmann

customer_reviews.title: be aware
customer_reviews.text: I am still trying to get familiar with it, few set backs, no zero clearance insert, thin cuts difficult to achieve no detente when angling the blade, it is a free swing no crank, no gear, you release the holding knob and the blade swings, to put it back in place is a straggle, the crank for moving the blade up or down is to close to the switch, I was cranking the blade up and as I was cranking hit the switch and the saw started running.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Banzhaf

customer_reviews.title: Mostly really good
customer_reviews.text: Meets all of my portable needs and looks good doing it! Rip guide is not all i wish it were but otherwise exactly what I needed for my small furniture shop
customer_reviews.author: Joseph King

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! Just popped it out of the box ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: great saw. Heavier than I like but with the ...
customer_reviews.text: great saw. Heavier than I like but with the wheels it's ok to move around
customer_reviews.author: Kori59

customer_reviews.title: Just one flaw but a biggie for me.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good portable saw, I just wish the guide was better quality. It wiggles a bit causing slight inaccuracies. If you're a stickler for precision that will turn you off for sure. Other wise no other complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos H. Ramirez Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this Saw. I make a lot of Car Audio boxes and it cuts perfect every time.
customer_reviews.author: Jhendrix

customer_reviews.title: Saw is good, but has problems.
customer_reviews.text: This saw works great, but it came with a lot of problems. The first saw that was deliverd came with damage (not from shipping) and was not usable. The second saw that was deliverd had damage also, but the saw was usable. All this damage was caused by the manufactuer so I complained to them directly. They promised replacement parts, but they never delivered. The saw performs great. Luckily the damage to my saw is not a major problem. All the features on this saw are nice. Do to the lack of thier quality control I can only say it is okay.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bosko

customer_reviews.title: Nice table saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: A very nice light weight saw. A bit flimsy but has been able to do what I expected. Nice saw for the money.
customer_reviews.author: PhoenixFred

customer_reviews.title: Its allright for a jobsite saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw is rated as a jobsite saw and that is what it is. When I purchased this saw I guess I expected more. The sawdust bag is useless, the adjustments do not hold very well and it is not accurate. I realize that being portable aluminum is used in the construction for the bed and wings but that is not a good idea. Cast iron and weight makes the saw run . Thanks Dave
customer_reviews.author: David Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine except it is hard to put the dust bag on.
customer_reviews.author: David Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Laser is not very useful. Easy setup. Plenty of power for my home workshop. Nice unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for the job site. Bought an extra blade for mill work. Works better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hall

customer_reviews.title: Table Saw Blade Aligment Rockwell RK7241S
customer_reviews.text: The First Unit that I Received Saw Blade Hit Table Called Rockwell They said Return It that the blade was not aligned correct at the factory. The Second Unit that I received I used It But Could Not Rip wood Straight as the Blade was Off from front to back over 1/4 of an inch Returned it back to Amazon. Rockwell should recall all models of the RK7241S Saws On the Market as they have a serious Blade alignment Problem. Amazon Fully refunded My Money and has an excellent return policy Thanks Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Lunsford

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small work shop (for now) 10 x 22. It is lite and easy to slide around for deferent size and shapes of wood. It does all it claims to do. I will get a more substantial one in my full grown shop. Always çheck the distance from fence to blade and that fence is square. I like it and am pleased with my purchase. I would recommend it for my situation and as a job site saw. You can move it like it was a piece o luggage because of the position of the wheels an the way the legs make a handle. Well thought out. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. It folds nicely, is ultra portable and even cuts wood! I love everything about this tool, Rockwell put a lot of thought when producing this product. Amazing convenience features for people that need an extra hand when lumbering.
customer_reviews.author: Valtyr

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Making adjustments, if any kind on this saw are almost impossible. The closest I can get the blade is 1/64" difference from the front to back of the blade. The riving knife doesn't line up with the blade correctly. Would not recommend to anyone and wish I would have bought the Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy F.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Allows working on big pieces of wood. Easy to assemble and all of the features worked fine, too.
customer_reviews.author: Roy S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Happy man!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband (he had picked it out) and it surpassed his expectations. Happy man!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Barton

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I have had no problems with it and would recommend it to any one who is interested in a table saw for home projects
customer_reviews.author: BuckeyeRon

customer_reviews.title: Runs smoothly!
customer_reviews.text: Not too loud when it's running. Easy to operate. Easy to put together. Easy to cart away. A little heavy but lighter then most other table saws. Excellent quality. Great precision.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelia

customer_reviews.title: part time woodworker
customer_reviews.text: its all set up, just take it out of the box -had to put a little side pressure on the fence to get a perfect aline with blade on far side can rip a 2x4 in half in no time -great " '
customer_reviews.author: shopman

customer_reviews.title: Lot`s O` Bang
customer_reviews.text: Lot`s O` Bang for the bucks. Professional quality cutting and durability that stores out of the way. Perfect for the weekend handyman
customer_reviews.author: A. Bisbing

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived very damaged - AMAZON fixed the problem - thanks
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to be more involved with Amazon with Prime; I read many reviews on this particular item and was optimistic. It arrived very damaged (metal crushed) and parts were loose in the box. I am thankful on Amazon returns process / I am going to try another one... but the experience was the worst I ever had with Amazon.com. Hopefully, UPS will pick this one up and things will be better... Next Day: UPS picked it up today... new one coming tomorrow...? UPDATE: NEW CAME quickly, return went well - everything since has been excellent - and, the product is an excellent saw!!! Highly recommended... and, PRIME was a good investment for many reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Lane

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design! # very disappointed with product
customer_reviews.text: Horrible design!# very disappointed with product. NEVER buy Rockwell products again I paid $371. when I returned it my refund was only 298.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Ketchum

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: saw cut well help to put a better blade like an 60 tooth comes with 40 tooth laser did not work not worth sending back for easy to use good for home dyi not as great of deal as they like you to think.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Petree

customer_reviews.title: Rockwell table saw
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saw for a new shop recently completed, small 10' by 10' wood shop. It fits perfectly and is easy to move around for cutting larger pieces of lumber. The adjustments are easy and the saw has plenty of power to cut even 3" oak boards. Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L Forschler

customer_reviews.title: Good Table Saw
customer_reviews.text: A cabinet saw would be better, but for the money I am happy with this. The fence and miter gauge does have some slop in it which is the biggest con. Doesn't have a dust port, no biggie for me. Love the laser line guide (minus the batteries since i keep forgetting to shut it off), adjustable leg, out feed support, and compact-ability. Cuts and works good, had no problems setting the blade 90 degrees!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I love my saw
customer_reviews.text: Cuts nice and strait, easy to assemble my first Amazon purchase nice and loud keeps kids and wives out of basement.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Burrier

customer_reviews.title: Plastic
customer_reviews.text: A lot of the housing is made of plastic and it cracked when I trying to store it away.It is not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: edward france

product_meta.title: Rockwell RK7241S Table Saw with Laser
product_meta.description:
Value not found

AMAZON.COM


Thanks to the integrated wheels and the ability to use an extended leg as a pull handle, the RK7241S is easy to transport from one job site to the next (view larger). The extra-long, 30-inch foldout fence provides a wide rip capacity (view larger). The Rockwell RK7241S 10-inch table saw with laser combines the best of power, precision, and portability for the utmost in versatility on the job site. It boasts four times the cutting capacity of comparable 10-inch table saws on the market, and its extra-long, 30-inch foldout fence provides the widest rip capacity. An integrated laser guide allows for consistent accuracy—the laser automatically realigns if the blade angle is beveled and never needs fine-tuning. Use an extended leg as a pull handle to effortlessly transport the saw on its built-in wheels from one job site to the next.

BIGGEST DEPTH OF CUT AND MOST RIP CUT CAPACITY IN ITS CLASS
Unlike other portable 10-inch table saws, Rockwell’s RK7241 can cut through a 4-by-4 piece of lumber in one fell swoop. Its maximum cutting depth is 3-9/16 inches at 90 degrees and 2-9/16 inches at 45 degrees. And its rip cut capacity is best in class thanks to the 30-inch table to the right of the blade (with 11 inches to the left) that allows you to efficiently cut a 4-by-8 sheet of plywood in half. With 15 amps of power and a rated no-load speed of 4,800 RPM, the RK7241S is ideal for tackling large projects proficiently.

LASER CUT LINE INDICATOR IMPROVES PRECISION
Rockwell’s LaserGuide technology improves accuracy and consistency of cuts by providing a true cutline indicator that displays exactly where the blade will cut the material at hand. It’s extremely useful for lining up cuts without needing to refer to the blade itself. Plus, when the blade is skewed for bevel cuts, the laser line automatically adjusts to the updated blade arrangement. 

TROLLEY STAND MAKES FOR EASY TRANSPORT
Thanks to the integrated wheels and the ability to use an extended leg as a pull handle, the RK7241S is easy to roll from the workshop to the job site to the garage and back again. And the included accessories—rip fence, miter gauge, push stick, riving knife, dust bag, and blade wrenches—are all stored on board so everything travels together. The saw and the stand are fully assembled immediately from the box, and the stand folds down in mere seconds, making for the ultimate in convenience while on the job.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
One Rockwell RK7241S table saw with laser, one rip fence, one miter gauge, one push stick, one riving knife, one dust bag, and two blade wrenches.

HIGHLIGHTS
 * Best-in-class cutting depth
 * One-of-a-kind laser indicator adjusts to blade tilt
 * Folding fence for extra wide cuts
 * Fully assembled trolley stand for easy transport
 * Backed by a two-year limited warranty

The RK7241S can cut through a 4-by-4 piece of lumber in one smooth cut (view larger). 

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The new Rockwell Jobsite Table Saw is a powerful, rugged ,and capable jobsite saw by itself. Add the available attachments and it can produce results to rival stationary saws three times the price, like those used by cabinet and furniture makers. Rockwell has found a way to increase the depth of cut to 3-9/16-Inch. This is more than other saws, and allows the user to cut through a 4 by 4 post with just one pass. The unique laser cut line indicator shows the exact place the blade will cut the material, so cuts are more precise. Other features include a class leading 30-Inch of cut capacity, and a quick-folding stand and wheels for easy transportation from place to place. The Attachment program for the Table Saw consists of a Sliding Extension Table and a Finisher. The Sliding Extension Table fits onto the left side of the saw, and expands the cutting capacity of the saw to a huge 36-3/4-Inch. Crosscutting, mitering, and taper cutting large sheets becomes a breeze. The Finisher is a unique accessory, using rapidly rotating blades to plane and smooth materials up to 3-1/8-Inch thick. Add these two accessories to turn this powerful jobsite saw into a portable precision woodworking saw and finisher.

See more

Most cutting depth of any saw in its class
Folding fence for extra wide cuts
Exclusive laser indicator adjusts blade tilt
Fully assembled trolley stand for portability.Rated No-load Speed:4800 rpm
